fig.title: : dTor and dLap1 differentially affect the fat body lipidome A) GL and GPL and enzymes.
fig.label: Figure 1
fig.sd-panel: GL and GPL and enzymes. Full abbreviations in Appendix Fig. S1A.
dTor and dLap1 topology.

Subcellular localization of dLap1mGFP and dTormGFP-E177Q in the wild-type
(w-) or dLap1+/∆11 fat body of 3rd instar fly larvae, when expressed as UAS transgenes.
Control, dTorKO and dLap1-/- larvae with pseudo-colored red fat body.
The relative abundance of individual GL and GPL classes in the wild-type fat body, as detected by mass spectrometry (MS). n=10 individual analyses.
TAG content of 3DO larvae measured by enzymatic assay. Bars show mean ± SEM measured in three sets of thirty larvae. One-Way ANOVA with Tukey's multiple comparison test. **** p < 0.0001.

The abundance of individual lipid classes (mean ± SEM) within the set of six membrane GL and GPL extracted from 4DO fat body samples. w- n = 7, dTorKO n = 7, dLap1-/- n = 4. One-Way ANOVA with Bonferroni's post hoc test. * p < 0.05 and ** p < 0.01.
Neutral lipid staining of the 5DO larval fat body. White arrows (O) indicate nuclear-localized neutral lipid staining, blue signal shows DAPI.
% of adult females that hatch after crossing female dTor+/- ;; dLap1-/TM6C with male y/FM7i ;; dLap1-/TM6C flies. Two-tailed T-Test. **** p < 0.0001, compared with expected Mendelian ratio (n≥3).

fig.title: : The dTor membrane domain and homo-oligomerization motif are important for dTor function in the fat body A) dTor mutants and chimeras.
fig.label: Figure 2
fig.sd-panel: dTor mutants and chimeras. Sig Seq, ER targeting signal sequence.
Wild-type and mutant dTormGFP proteins expressed in dTorKO fat body cells.

Size of individual fat body cells (C) and LD density of individual fat body cells (D). Bars show the group mean, light grey highlights 2x SD of the control mean (animals expressing the Sec61b control ER protein), and dotted red lines show dTorKO mean. These are results of n≥3 larvae (of 3 independent crosses). One-way ANOVA, with Bonferroni's post hoc test. ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001 and **** p <0.0001.
GFP, Phalloidin and LipidTOX detect the expression of dTormGFP chimeras (green), cell boundaries (red), and LD (red), respectively, in dTorKO fat body cells.

fig.title: : dTor affects the fat body lipidome via Nep1r1, Ctdnep1 and Lipin A) dTorKO larvae expressing UAS RNAi transgenes or expressing a wild-type dTor cDNA (positive control).
fig.label: Figure 3
fig.sd-panel: dTorKO larvae expressing UAS RNAi transgenes or expressing a wild-type dTor cDNA (positive control). The fat body is pseudo-colored red.
Topology of NEP1R1, CTDNEP1, and Lipin.
Fat body cells labeled by BODIPY to detect neutral lipids.

The relative abundance of each lipid class (mean ± SEM) within the set of six membrane lipids. n = 3 MS analyses of 4DO fat body samples for each genotype. ‡ symbols indicate a significant difference compared to w- expressing Luciferase RNAi, * symbols indicate a significant difference compared to dTorKO expressing luciferase RNAi. Note we only tested the effect of Lipin, Ctdnep1, and Nep1r1 RNAi when a lipid class significantly differed between w- and dTorKO. One-way ANOVA, Tukey's multiple comparisons test. * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001, **** p < 0.0001 and ‡‡‡‡ p < 0.0001.
As above except that TAG abundance was calculated relative to protein. One-way ANOVA, Tukey's multiple comparisons test.

Bars show the fraction (mean ± SEM) of membrane GL and GPL lipids with each fatty acyl chain characteristic. n = 3 MS analyses of 4DO fat body samples for each genotype. MUFA, mono-unsaturated; PUFA, poly-unsaturated. ‡ indicate a significant difference between w- and dTorKO expressing Luciferase RNAi, * indicate a significant difference compared to dTorKO expressing Luciferase RNAi. Two-way ANOVA, Dunnett's multiple comparison test. ‡ p < 0.05 and * p < 0.05.

fig.title: : CTDNEP1 and Lipin concentrate at the NE of fly and mouse cells lacking Torsins A - D) Control and dTorKO 5DO fat body cells expressing UAS GFP fusion proteins with the Cg-Gal4 driver, and labeled with anti-Calnexin (red) and a neutral lipid dye (LipidTOX, magenta).
fig.label: Figure 4
fig.sd-panel: Control and dTorKO 5DO fat body cells expressing UAS GFP fusion proteins with the Cg-Gal4 driver, and labeled with anti-Calnexin (red) and a neutral lipid dye (LipidTOX, magenta). Note that dTorKO cells are smaller. White arrowhead indicates NE enrichment of LipinmGFP.
CTDNEP1Scarlet and anti-Sun1 localization in MEFs.

Lipin1mGFP localization in HEK293T cells transfected with a plasmid that co-expresses CTDNEP1myc-WT or -CD (red) and NEP1R1V5 (magenta). (G') Upper: enlargement of panel G, white arrow highlights NE enrichment. Lower: plot showing the intensity of Lipin1mGFP signal (mean ± SD, n = 5 cells) along a 3 µm profile that transects the NE at 0 µm.
Mouse Lipin1mGFP expressed in MEFs, red signal shows Calreticulin.
Percentage of MEFs with primarily cytosolic or nuclear Lipin1mGFP. Chi-square test. **** p < 0.0001.

fig.title: : dTor loss impairs NPC insertion during nuclear growth in developing fat body cells A) Interphase NPC insertion occurs via inside-out extrusion of the INM, followed by INM/ONM fission and fusion (Otsuka & Ellenberg, 2018).
fig.label: Figure 5
fig.sd-panel: Interphase NPC insertion occurs via inside-out extrusion of the INM, followed by INM/ONM fission and fusion (Otsuka & Ellenberg, 2018). Nucleoporins are not depicted. The mature NPC, highlighting proteins examined in fat body cells. Green, cytosolic filaments; yellow, outer ring subcomplex; pale blue, inner ring subcomplex; brown, transmembrane nucleoporins; red, phenylalanine-glycine repeats (FG-Nups) that form the permeability barrier; white/blue, nuclear basket Nups.
Fat body nuclei increase in size during development. Graph shows mean ± SD for each day during development of larvae. DO, day-old.
Control (w-) and dTorKO fat body nuclei labeled with anti-LaminDm0, Megator/Tpr, mAb414, or expressing UAS Nup107GFP or UAS Nup358GFP with the Cg-Gal4 driver.
Representative TEM of the NE of control and dTorKO 5DO fat body cells. Red arrows show nuclear pores. Nuc, nucleus; Cyto, cytosol.
The percentage of NE in individual 5DO fat body cells that has normal INM, ONM, and NPC morphology. Black lines show the mean of each group.
Representative TEM showing the NE of 5DO dLap1-/- fat body cells. Red arrows in (Q) show nuclear pores. Dashed yellow line highlights unusual circular membrane profiles.

fig.title: : Nep1r1 and Ctdnep1 downregulation restore NPC levels and suppress INM herniations in dTorKO cells A) mAb414 labeling of 5DO dTorKO fat body cells expressing the dTor cDNA, Luciferase RNAi, or RNAi against Nep1r1, Ctdnep1, or Lipin.
fig.label: Figure 6
fig.sd-panel: mAb414 labeling of 5DO dTorKO fat body cells expressing the dTor cDNA, Luciferase RNAi, or RNAi against Nep1r1, Ctdnep1, or Lipin. Nuc, nucleus. The percentage of fat body cells with NE-localized mAb414. ** and **** indicate that Lipin, Ctdnep1, and Nep1r1 RNAi significantly increased the number of dTorKO cells with NE-specific mAb414 labeling compared to the Luciferase RNAi (Luc). Chi-square test followed by individual post hoc Chi-square tests. ** p < 0.01 and **** p < 0.0001. NE ultrastructure in 5DO dTorKO cells. Red arrows, nuclear pores; yellow arrows, abnormal INM herniations. Nuc, nucleus; Cyto, cytosol.

The density of NPC detected by TEM in the 5DO dTorKO NE. Each point shows the mean of multiple measurements from an individual nucleus, bars show mean ± SD for the group (n = 5). One-way ANOVA, with Bonferroni's post hoc test. ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001 and **** p <0.0001.
Same as above except that the density of INM herniations is presented.

The percentage of NE in 5DO fat body cells that has normally appearing INM, ONM, and NPC morphology. Points show values from individual nuclei (n = 5). Bars show mean ± SD. Grey zone shows +/- 2x SD of the positive control mean, dotted red line shows mean of dTorKO expressing Luciferase RNAi. One-way ANOVA, with Bonferroni's post hoc test. ** p < 0.01 and **** p <0.0001.

The percentage that Lipin, Ctdnep1, and Nep1r1 RNAi normalize the abundance of membrane GL and GPL classes in the dTorKO fat body. 0% "normal" reflects lipid abundance in dTorKO expressing Luciferase RNAi, while 100% "normal" reflects lipid abundance in w- expressing Luciferase RNAi. Percentage normalization was separately calculated for PI, PA, DAG, PC, PE and PS (for dTorKO expressing Lipin, Ctdnep1, and Nep1r1 RNAi). Points show the mean of all lipid class normalization per sample, bars show mean ± SEM for the group.

fig.title: : Abnormal nucleocytoplasmic membrane channels occur in fat body cells overexpressing NEP1R1, CTDNEP1 or Lipin, and dLap1-/- cells A - C) Fat body cells expressing GFP tagged UAS transgenes with r4-Gal4.
fig.label: Figure 7
fig.sd-panel: Fat body cells expressing GFP tagged UAS transgenes with r4-Gal4

TAG (nmol/ μg protein) in the 4 DO fat body expressing UAS transgenes with the r4-Gal4 driver. Bars show group mean +/- SEM (n = 6), points show values from individual MS runs. Unpaired T-Test. ** p < 0.01

NE ultrastructure of 5DO fat body cells overexpressing UAS transgenes, or from dLap1-/- animals. Yellow dotted lines highlight NE regions with subtly abnormal membrane architecture. Red arrows indicate nuclear pores. R1, region 1; R2, region2; Nuc, nucleus; Cyto, cytosol

Data from FIB-SEM imaging of fat body nuclei expressing Sec61b (control), or CTDNEP1mGFP. (J - L) 3D reconstructions, (M) distance between the INM and ONM at NPC in wild-type cells versus CTDNEP1mGFP-induced structures. Kolmogorov-Smirnov non-parametric T-Test. **** p < 0.0001
TEM analysis of the NE in 5DO fat body cells expressing Ctdnep1 with DAGK or Sec61 (control). Red arrows indicate nuclear pores

fig.title: : Impaired Nup35 recruitment can explain the abnormal membrane channels caused by excess PA to DAG conversion A) The NPC is comprised of several subcomplexes.
fig.label: Figure 8
fig.sd-panel: The NPC is comprised of several subcomplexes.
Confocal imaging of 5DO fat body nuclei expressing UAS transgenes and labeled by anti-Megator/Tpr, Nup214, Nup35,
Confocal imaging of 5DO fat body nuclei expressing UAS transgenes and labeled by mAb414, or expressing Nup107RFP.

mAb414 localization in 5DO fat body cells expressing the indicated UAS transgenes or from a dLap1-/- animal. *** and **** indicate significant difference compared to control mGFPSec61b expressing cells. Chi-square test followed by individual post hoc Chi-square tests. *** p < 0.001 and **** p < 0.0001.
NE ultrastructure of 5DO fat body cells from a (I) control animal, (J) homozygous Nup35BG01311 and (K) homozygous Nup35MB02683 animals. Nuc, nucleus; Cyto, cytosol.
Model of the relationship between nucleocytoplasmic channels, PA metabolism, and NPC maturation.
